required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pan Asian Trial Comparing Efficacy and Safety of NN5401 and Biphasic Insulin Aspart 30 in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Pan Asian Trial Comparing Efficacy and Safety of NN5401 and Biphasic Insulin Aspart 30 in Type 2 Diabetes (BOOST™: INTENSIFY ALL)

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare
South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Asia. The aim of this clinical trial is to compare NN5401 (insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp)) with biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp) 30 in patients with type 2 diabetes not optimally controlled on once or twice daily insulin with or without metformin.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) After 26 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean of 9-point Self Measured Plasma Glucose Profile (SMPG) at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of SMPG at 26 weeks of treatment. Plasma glucose measured: before breakfast, 90 minutes after start of breakfast, before lunch, 90 minutes after start of lunch, before dinner, 90 minutes after start of dinner, bedtime, at 4 am and before breakfast.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Nocturnal Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L. Nocturnal hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as occuring between 00:01 and 05:59 a.m.
Change from baseline in body weight after 26 weeks of treatment.

intervention.description: Injected subcutaneously twice daily. Dose was individually adjusted.
Injected subcutaneously twice daily. Dose was individually adjusted.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female at least 18 years of age (at least 20 years for Japan)
- Type 2 diabetes mellitus (diagnosed clinically) for at least 6 months
- Subject on basal human or analogue insulin, once daily (OD) or twice daily (BID) with or without metformin for at least 3 months or subject on premixed human or analogue insulin or self-mixed insulin regimen, containing 20-40% fast/rapid-acting component, OD or BID, with or without metformin, for at least 3 months
- HbA1c 7.0-10.0 % (both inclusive) by central laboratory analysis
- Body mass index (BMI) maximum 35.0 kg/m^2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with oral antidiabetic drugs (OADs) (except metformin) within the last 8 weeks prior to Visit 1
- Treatment with thiazolidinediones (TZDs) or glucagon like peptide 1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists within 3 months prior to Visit 1
- Cardiovascular disease, within the last 6 months prior to Visit 1, defined as: stroke; decompensated heart failure New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III or IV; myocardial infarction; unstable angina pectoris; or coronary arterial bypass graft or angioplasty
- Uncontrolled treated/untreated severe hypertension (systolic blood pressure at least 180 millimetre (mm) mercury (Hg) and/or diastolic blood pressure at least 100 mmHg)
- Pregnancy, breast-feeding, the intention of becoming pregnant or not using adequate contraceptive measures according to local requirements
- Cancer and medical history of cancer (except basal cell skin cancer or squamous cell skin cancer)

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin aspart, insulin aspart protamine drug combination 30:70

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial was conducted at 45 sites in 5 countries: Japan (16 sites), South Korea (16 sites), Hong Kong (1 site), Malaysia (8 sites) and Taiwan (4 sites).

group.title: IDegAsp BID
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

group.title: BIAsp 30 BID
group.description: Biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp 30) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

participants_list.participants: Three subjects withdrew prior to exposure to trial drug
One subject withdrew prior to exposure to trial drug

baseline.population: Baseline characterises are presented for full analysis set (FAS), which included all randomized subjects. In exceptional cases subjects from the FAS were eliminated; 2 subjects in the IDegAsp group were excluded from the FAS because the subjects were randomized in error in spite of being screening failures.

group.title: IDegAsp BID
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

group.title: BIAsp 30 BID
group.description: Biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp 30) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) After 26 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data were imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: IDegAsp BID
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

group.title: BIAsp 30 BID
group.description: Biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp 30) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

measure.title: Change in HbA1c (Glycosylated Haemoglobin) After 26 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 26 weeks of treatment.

outcome.title: Mean of 9-point Self Measured Plasma Glucose Profile (SMPG) at Week 26
outcome.description: Mean of SMPG at 26 weeks of treatment. Plasma glucose measured: before breakfast, 90 minutes after start of breakfast, before lunch, 90 minutes after start of lunch, before dinner, 90 minutes after start of dinner, bedtime, at 4 am and before breakfast.
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised subjects and missing data were imputed using last observation carried forward (LOCF). For 24 subjects all 9-point SMPG values were missing.

group.title: IDegAsp BID
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

group.title: BIAsp 30 BID
group.description: Biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp 30) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

measure.title: Mean of 9-point Self Measured Plasma Glucose Profile (SMPG) at Week 26
measure.description: Mean of SMPG at 26 weeks of treatment. Plasma glucose measured: before breakfast, 90 minutes after start of breakfast, before lunch, 90 minutes after start of lunch, before dinner, 90 minutes after start of dinner, bedtime, at 4 am and before breakfast.

outcome.title: Rate of Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcome.description: Rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product or its comparator.

group.title: IDegAsp BID
group.description: Insulin degludec/insulin aspart (IDegAsp) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

group.title: BIAsp 30 BID
group.description: Biphasic insulin aspart (BIAsp 30) was given twice daily (BID) with breakfast and evening meal with or without metformin.

measure.title: Rate of Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
measure.description: Rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol.

outcome.title: Rate of Nocturnal Confirmed Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcome.description: Rate of confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes per 100 patient years of exposure (PYE). Confirmed hypoglycaemic episodes consisted of severe hypoglycaemia as well as minor hypoglycaemic episodes. Severe hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as requiring assistance to administer carbohydrate, glucagon, or other resuscitative actions. Minor hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L. Nocturnal hypoglycaemic episodes are defined as occuring between 00:01 and 05:59 a.m.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 to Week 26 + 7 days follow up
outcome.population: The safety analysis set included all subjects who received at least one dose of the investigational product or its comparator.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk maintains the right to be informed of any Investigator plans for publication and to review any scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol. Any such communication must be submitted in writing to the Novo Nordisk trial manager prior to submission for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the planned communication.
